name: ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow
comment: Use the chrome.devtools.inspectedWindow API to interact with the inspected window: obtain the tab ID for the inspected page, evaluate the code in the context of the inspected window, reload the page, or obtain the list of resources within the page.

onResourceAdded.name: onResourceAdded
onResourceAdded.comment: Fired when a new resource is added to the inspected page.

onResourceContentCommitted.name: onResourceContentCommitted
onResourceContentCommitted.comment: Fired when a new revision of the resource is committed (e.g. user saves an edited version of the resource in the Developer Tools).

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

tabId.name: tabId
tabId.comment: The ID of the tab being inspected. This ID may be used with chrome.tabs.* API.

eval.name: eval
eval.comment:
Evaluates a JavaScript expression in the context of the main frame of the inspected page. The expression must evaluate to a JSON-compliant object, otherwise an exception is thrown.

chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.eval.expression An expression to evaluate.

Returns: result The result of evaluation. isException Set if an exception was caught while evaluating the expression.

getResources.name: getResources
getResources.comment:
Retrieves the list of resources from the inspected page.

Returns: The resources within the page.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

available.name: available
available.comment:
Returns true if the API is available. The common causes of an API not being avilable are:

  • a permission is missing in the application's manifest.json file
  • the API is defined on a newer version of Chrome then the current runtime

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of chrome/chrome_ext.ChromeDevtoolsInspectedWindow.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
